name: unpruned
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
An unpruned plant or tree has not been pruned (= had some branches cut off so that it will grow better): The garden was full of unpruned roses and rampant weeds. Plants will become sprawling and woody if left unpruned.
More examplesFewer examplesIf you leave clematis unpruned, new growth from the previous year's shoots begins and the plant soon gets out of hand.Unpruned, it can reach 15 to 20 feet in height and in width. The house was set back from the road and surrounded by well-grown trees and unpruned hedges.
